titles: King James his letter and directions to the Lord Archbishop of Canterbury concerning preaching and preachers with the Bishop of Canterburies letter to the Bishop of Lincolne, Lord Keeper, desiring him to put in practise the Kings desires that none should preach but in a religious forme : and not that every young man should take to himselfe an exorbitant liberty to preach what he listeth to the offence of His Majesty and the disturbance and disquiet of the church and common-wealth.
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
Abbot, George, 1562-1633.
notes: "The Arch-bishop of Canterburies [George Abbot's] letter, to the Archbishop of Yorke [Tobias Matthew]": p. 5-8.
"The Lord Arch-bishops letter to the Lord Keeper [John Williams].": p. 8-9.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
keywords: Church of England --  Customs and practices --  17th century.
